AIDS are serious illnesses.  
✱ One can protect oneself from getting the disease
✱ Change in sexual behaviour will prevent people from getting this disease   
✱ HIV-positive people should ALWAYS be treated like normal people. They are not  untouchable.
✱ Treatment is available for HIV-positive people and for AIDS.
✱ HIV positive women who are on adequate treatment can plan to have a baby.  
✱ It is important to adhere to advice and treatment to avoid transmission to the baby.
Non-communicable diseases
Non-communicable diseases are slow progressing, long-duration, largely preventable diseases that result from many common modifiable risk factors, 
mainly behaviours.
Four major non-communicable diseases are diabetes, cardiovascular diseases, 
cancers, and chronic respiratory diseases. These diseases share common risk 
factors such as tobacco use, unhealthy diet, physical inactivity and excessive use 
of alcohol.
